content:
HierarchicalDataSourceDesigner Class

In this Article

Provides design-time support in a visual designer for the HierarchicalDataSourceControl control.

Syntax

Declaration

public class HierarchicalDataSourceDesigner : System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner, System.Web.UI.Design.IHierarchicalDataSourceDesigner

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • ComponentDesigner
  • HtmlControlDesigner
  • System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner
  • HierarchicalDataSourceDesigner

Remarks

The HierarchicalDataSourceDesigner class is a base class for deriving your own data source designer for a custom data source control derived from the HierarchicalDataSourceControl class. Other classes that derive from HierarchicalDataSourceDesigner are XmlDataSourceDesigner and SiteMapDataSourceDesigner.

Constructors summary

HierarchicalDataSourceDesigner()

Initializes a new instance of the HierarchicalDataSourceDesigner class.

Properties summary

ActionLists

Gets the action list collection for the control designer.
CanConfigure

Gets a value that indicates whether the stem.Web.UI.Design.IHierarchicalDataSourceDesigner.Configure* method can be called.
CanRefreshSchema

Gets a value that indicates whether the stem.Web.UI.Design.IHierarchicalDataSourceDesigner.RefreshSchema* method can be called.
SuppressingDataSourceEvents

Indicates whether data source events have been disabled.

Methods summary

Configure()

Launches the configuration wizard for the underlying data source.
GetDesignTimeHtml()

Gets the HTML markup that is used to represent the control at design time.
GetView(String)

Gets the named data source view associated with the data source control.
OnDataSourceChanged(EventArgs)

Raises the DataSourceChanged event when the properties of the data source have changed and the stem.Web.UI.Design.HierarchicalDataSourceDesigner.SuppressingDataSourceEvents* property value is false.
OnSchemaRefreshed(EventArgs)

Raises the SchemaRefreshed event when the schema of the data source has changed and the stem.Web.UI.Design.HierarchicalDataSourceDesigner.SuppressingDataSourceEvents* property value is false.
RefreshSchema(Boolean)

Refreshes the schema of the data.
ResumeDataSourceEvents()

Restores data source events after they have been suppressed.
SuppressDataSourceEvents()

Postpones all data source events until after the stem.Web.UI.Design.HierarchicalDataSourceDesigner.ResumeDataSourceEvents* method is called.

Events summary

DataSourceChanged

Occurs when any property of the associated data source changes.
SchemaRefreshed

Occurs after the schema has been refreshed.

Constructors

  • HierarchicalDataSourceDesigner()

    Initializes a new instance of the HierarchicalDataSourceDesigner class.

    public HierarchicalDataSourceDesigner ();

Properties

  • ActionLists

    Gets the action list collection for the control designer.

    public override System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection ActionLists { get; }

    Property Value

    • DesignerActionListCollection

      A DesignerActionListCollection object that contains the DesignerActionList items for the control designer.

  • CanConfigure

    Gets a value that indicates whether the stem.Web.UI.Design.IHierarchicalDataSourceDesigner.Configure* method can be called.

    public virtual bool CanConfigure { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      This implementation always returns false.

    Remarks

    A design host, such as Visual Studio 2005, uses this property to determine whether to show a Configure command in the Smart-Tag menu in design view.

  • CanRefreshSchema

    Gets a value that indicates whether the stem.Web.UI.Design.IHierarchicalDataSourceDesigner.RefreshSchema* method can be called.

    public virtual bool CanRefreshSchema { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      This implementation always returns false.

    Remarks

    A design host, such as Visual Studio 2005, uses this property to determine whether to show a Refresh Schema command in the Smart-Tag menu in design view.

  • SuppressingDataSourceEvents

    Indicates whether data source events have been disabled.

    protected bool SuppressingDataSourceEvents { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the DataSourceChanged or SchemaRefreshed event has been disabled; otherwise, false.

Methods

  • Configure()

    Launches the configuration wizard for the underlying data source.

    public virtual void Configure ();

    Exceptions

    • NotSupportedException

      In all cases.

    Remarks

    The Configure method is not supported in the HierarchicalDataSourceDesigner class.

  • GetDesignTimeHtml()

    Gets the HTML markup that is used to represent the control at design time.

    public override string GetDesignTimeHtml ();

    Returns

    • String

      The HTML markup used to represent the control at design time.

  • GetView(String)

    Gets the named data source view associated with the data source control.

    public virtual System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerHierarchicalDataSourceView GetView (string viewPath);

    Parameters

    • viewPath
      String

      The unique path to the block of data to use in creating the view.

    Returns

    • DesignerHierarchicalDataSourceView

      A DesignerHierarchicalDataSourceView object.

  • OnDataSourceChanged(EventArgs)

    Raises the DataSourceChanged event when the properties of the data source have changed and the stem.Web.UI.Design.HierarchicalDataSourceDesigner.SuppressingDataSourceEvents* property value is false.

    protected virtual void OnDataSourceChanged (EventArgs e);

    Parameters

    • e
      EventArgs

      An EventArgs object provided by the calling object.

    Remarks

    The OnDataSourceChanged method notifies the designer of each control bound to the associated data source to refresh its control in the design host. This method can be suppressed with the SuppressDataSourceEvents method, or by calling the RefreshSchema method with an argument of false.

  • OnSchemaRefreshed(EventArgs)

    Raises the SchemaRefreshed event when the schema of the data source has changed and the stem.Web.UI.Design.HierarchicalDataSourceDesigner.SuppressingDataSourceEvents* property value is false.

    protected virtual void OnSchemaRefreshed (EventArgs e);

    Parameters

    • e
      EventArgs

      An EventArgs object.

    Remarks

    This method notifies the designers of each control bound to the associated data source that the fields in the schema have changed. This method can be suppressed with the SuppressDataSourceEvents method, or by calling the RefreshSchema method with an argument of true.

  • RefreshSchema(Boolean)

    Refreshes the schema of the data.

    public virtual void RefreshSchema (bool preferSilent);

    Parameters

    • preferSilent
      Boolean

      This parameter is not used in this implementation. However, it should be supported in derived classes.

    Exceptions

    • NotSupportedException

      In all cases.

    Remarks

    This method is not supported in this class, but is implemented in derived classes, such as the XmlDataSourceDesigner class.

  • ResumeDataSourceEvents()

    Restores data source events after they have been suppressed.

    public virtual void ResumeDataSourceEvents ();

    Exceptions

    • InvalidOperationException

      The stem.Web.UI.Design.HierarchicalDataSourceDesigner.SuppressingDataSourceEvents* property is false.

    Remarks

    Data source events can be suppressed by setting the SuppressingDataSourceEvents property to false, or by calling the RefreshSchema method with an argument of true.

  • SuppressDataSourceEvents()

    Postpones all data source events until after the stem.Web.UI.Design.HierarchicalDataSourceDesigner.ResumeDataSourceEvents* method is called.

    public virtual void SuppressDataSourceEvents ();

Events

  • DataSourceChanged

    Occurs when any property of the associated data source changes.

    public event EventHandler DataSourceChanged;
  • SchemaRefreshed

    Occurs after the schema has been refreshed.

    public event EventHandler SchemaRefreshed;
